hook.text: A dentist recommends a toothpaste on TV. Sales spike. Nobody checks if the dentist is even real.

buildup.text: We defer to authority instinctively. Lab coats, titles, and credentials trigger automatic trust.

discovery.text: Milgram's experiment showed people obeying authority figures even against their own moral judgment.

twist.text: Authority can be borrowed. A startup with one Stanford advisor gains credibility it hasn't earned.

climax.text: The danger is empty authority. If credentials don't match the claim, trust collapses hard.

punchline.text: A title opens the door. Substance keeps it open.

quiz.question: What did Milgram's experiment reveal about authority?
options: People obey authority even against their own judgment
Authority has no effect on decisions
